title: Atlassian Rich Lister leads donors to raise $1.1m at SCHF gala
text:
Guy Sebastian performing at the Sydney Children Hospital's SunSCHine gala charity event. AFR

The Sydney Children Hospital's SunSCHine gala charity event — one of a calendar of bizoid charity parties that help fund the hospital's cutting-edge treatment and research — drew a hefty crowd at the Four Seasons Hotel in Sydney.

Mike and Annie Cannon-Brookes at the Sydney Children Hospital's SunSCHine gala charity event photo is supplied. 27 October 2019. Kai Godeck

Chipping in more than $100,000 each were Annie and Mike Cannon-Brookes, the Atlassian co-founder and Young Rich List topper, as well as MPA founder Ben Richie. Other significant donors included Christopher Joye's credit hedge fund Coolabah Capital ($60,000 donated) and Oceana CEO (and nationally-ranked surf life saver) David Lewis who spotted the hospital $20,000.

Guy Sebastian was on hand to provide the entertainment, which seemed to go down a treat, enticing AMP CEO Francesco De Ferrari, Westpac group treasurer Curt Zuber and Betashares chief Alex Vynokur to the dancefloor (no pictures of that, alas).

Also spotted bopping along: billionaires-in-waiting Chad Walker and Robert Ell (the sons of Lang Walker and Bob Ell) and fashion designers Nicky Zimmerman and Marnie Skillings.

A total of $1.1 million was raised for the Sydney Children's Hospital Foundation.
description: The Sydney Children Hospital's SunSCHine gala charity event drew a hefty crowd at the Four Seasons Hotel in Sydney.
